I am running FirefoxVersion 146.0.1 (64-bit)onWin11(andgetting erratic spaces and backspaces again.)

Interestingly, the main Enter key also has similar problems although the keypad Enter key seldom does.

TheDeletekeyhasneverhad this kind of problem so I haveoften used back-arrow and Delete instead of Backspace.

Tobefair,thisalsohappenswithNotepad++ and other programs.

I have no idea how to troubleshoot such an erratic/intermittent situation.

title: Firefox 146.0.1 for Windows (64-bit) update has lost my bookmarks and will not let me load a backup
content:
I'm running Windows 11 Home (fully patched). Firefox recently updated to the above-mentioned version. Since then, I've "lost" all my bookmarks and cannot load any backup version from the "Old Firefox Data" folder (which has several bookmark backup files). My security software is Windows Security..

The IMPORT/EXPORT function in the Bookmarks Manager reports no backups nor any bookmarks at all.

The same IMPORT/EXPORT function won't allow me to maneuver/select any of the bookmark backup files for importation.

Last, I cannot find any instructions on how to manually restore my bookmarks.

I live in a rural area and the power has gone out twice in the last 10 days. While I have my PC connected to a UPS with line purification, the power was out for hours draining the UPS battery. Both times I was not home to do a controlled shutdown. This bookmark error happened after the first power outage, but I was able to restore form an old backup. This time, however, I'm unable to restore.

I'd appreciate any assistance in this matter.

title: Tabs not closing unless right click -> close or ctrl+w
content: OS: Linux Recently, firefox has been annoying me with not closing a tab when I click the X like normal. I have to right click and close it, or press ctrl w. I am unable to move tabs around, as well. I am not sure since when this next bit has been happening, but I am also unable to interact with many elements of the top bar. The only thing of the firefox ui besides the websites themselves that let me interact with them at the moment is the home button, the new tab button, bookmarked sites, and that box icon on the left corner that lets you look at previously closed tabs. My Firefox's version should around, I believe it is 140.5.0 ESR. Thank you in advance. Update: Upon a restart of firefox, it appears to be working again as normal.. However, the bit with tabs not closing when the X is clicked and not being able to move tabs around has been happening multiple previous times, and it may come back.
